perturbation.original_text: Company shall sell and deliver as provided in Section 2.3 of this Agreement to Distributor on the price terms set forth in this Agreement or as amended from time to time such quantity of Products as Distributor from time to time orders from Company. Company shall promote and advertise the Products generally, at its own expense, and shall furnish Distributor copies at all advertisement and promotional materials.
perturbation.changed_text: Company shall endeavor to sell and deliver as provided in Section 2.3 of this Agreement to Distributor on the price terms set forth in this Agreement or as amended from time to time such quantity of Products as Distributor from time to time orders from Company. Company will attempt to promote and advertise the Products generally, at its own expense, and shall furnish Distributor copies of advertisement and promotional materials, if conveniently available.
perturbation.explanation: The original text contains a clear obligation on the Company to sell and deliver products as ordered. The modified text replaces 'shall sell and deliver' with 'shall endeavor to sell and deliver' and 'shall promote and advertise' with 'will attempt to promote and advertise'. It also makes the provision of promotional material depend on availability. This introduces ambiguity and makes the company's obligation discretionary, rather than mandatory.
perturbation.contradicted_law: Illinois Uniform Commercial Code - Obligation of Good Faith
perturbation.law_explanation: The modification weakens the commitment of the company to sell and deliver the products to the distributor, using terms like 'endeavor to' and 'attempt to', which introduces discretion. This could violate the implied covenant of good faith and fair dealing under the Illinois Uniform Commercial Code (810 ILCS 5/1-304), which requires parties to a contract to act honestly and reasonably in its performance and enforcement. This modification allows the company to potentially avoid fulfilling orders or promoting the product, undermining the distributor's ability to succeed.

perturbation.original_text: The Distributor, at its own expense, shall promote the distribution, sales, and use of Products in the Market.
perturbation.changed_text: The Distributor, at its own expense, should consider promoting the distribution, sales, and use of Products in the Market.
perturbation.explanation: The original text states that the distributor 'shall promote' the products, imposing a clear duty. The changed text replaces 'shall promote' with 'should consider promoting', which introduces ambiguity and makes the promotional efforts discretionary. This weakens the distributor's obligation.
perturbation.law_explanation: The weakening of the promotional obligation via the change to 'should consider promoting' impacts the spirit of the agreement which intends to ensure diligent sales activity, but also potentially undermines a sales representative's ability to earn commissions if actively discouraged from sales, thereby conflicting with the intent behind the Illinois Sales Representative Act, which protects sales representatives' rights to commissions.

perturbation.original_text: Company shall at all times make reasonable efforts to maintain quality control and to deliver Products to Distributor which, when received by Distributor, or, as the case may be, the end-user, are properly and adequately packaged and contained, fully assembled (except for miscellaneous components which may be shipped separately to prevent damage in transit), fully functional and otherwise in conformance with the warranties set forth herein.
perturbation.changed_text: Company shall generally try to maintain quality control and to deliver Products to Distributor which, when received by Distributor, or, as the case may be, the end-user, appear to be reasonably packaged and contained, mostly assembled, generally functional and arguably in conformance with the warranties set forth herein.
perturbation.explanation: The original text imposes a reasonable effort to maintain quality and deliver specific product attributes. The changed text weakens this obligation through terms like 'generally try', 'appear to be reasonably packaged', 'mostly assembled', 'generally functional', and 'arguably in conformance'. This introduces significant ambiguity regarding the company's responsibility for quality and product condition.
perturbation.contradicted_law: Illinois Uniform Commercial Code - Implied Warranty of Merchantability
perturbation.law_explanation: By using subjective and vague language ('appear to be reasonably packaged', 'mostly assembled', 'generally functional'), the modified text undermines the implied warranty of merchantability under the Illinois Uniform Commercial Code (810 ILCS 5/2-314). This warranty requires that goods be fit for the ordinary purposes for which such goods are used. The changes allow for products that may not meet basic standards of functionality or packaging, contradicting the requirement of merchantability.
